name: Hydroxyzine

dosing.notes: Non-controlled anxiolytic; antihistamine; sedating; can be used PRN; no abuse potential; alternative to benzodiazepines

canadian_clinical.starting_dose: 25 mg TID PRN or 25-50 mg qHS
canadian_clinical.titration_schedule: Increase to 50-100 mg TID-QID as needed
canadian_clinical.max_dose_practice: 100-200 mg/day divided for anxiety; higher doses for severe anxiety or agitation
canadian_clinical.inpatient_strategy: 25-100 mg TID-QID PRN for agitation or anxiety; IM formulation available
canadian_clinical.outpatient_strategy: Start 25 mg TID PRN; can use regularly or PRN; good benzodiazepine alternative

warnings: QTc prolongation - use caution with other QTc-prolonging agents
Anticholinergic effects - dry mouth, urinary retention, constipation (less than TCAs)
No abuse potential or dependence - excellent benzodiazepine alternative
Generally well-tolerated; safe in most populations

cautions.renal: Reduce dose by 50% in renal impairment
cautions.pregnancy: Pregnancy Category C; avoid in first trimester; safe option later in pregnancy
